<h4 style="display: inline-block;"><img src="img/water_icon.png" alt="description of the image" style="vertical-align: middle; margin: 0px 10px; width: 5%">Water resources</h4>

```{r out.width='30%', out.extra='style="float:right; padding:10px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("img/maps/water_map.png")
```

This layer corresponds to the Water Resource Areas of Interest developed by the Conservation Biology Institute for the Santa Barbara County Conservation Blueprint. The map highlights areas of interest for water resources by overlaying a variety of inputs, including information on wetlands, waterways, groundwater, and watershed assessments.

You can access the original data here: 
[Water Resource "Areas of Interest"](https://sbcblueprint.databasin.org/datasets/fc3d91cbadf849d296e20a63ec2c2ac9/)


<br>
<h4 style="display: inline-block;"><img src="img/bio_icon.png" alt="description of the image" style="vertical-align: middle; margin: 0px 10px; width: 5%">Biodiversity</h4>

```{r out.width='30%', out.extra='style="float:right; padding:10px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("img/maps/bio_map.png")
```

The layer corresponds to the Flora and Fauna Areas of Interest created by the Conservation Biology Institute for the Santa Barbara County Conservation Blueprint. The map highlights areas of interest for ecological resources by overlaying a variety of metrics related to fluvial systems, suitability for fauna, the existence of rare and endangered species, presence of protected vegetation, and connectivity.

You can access the original data here:
[Flora and Fauna "Areas of Interest"](https://sbcblueprint.databasin.org/datasets/b1e62c59d66b4f2f9ab0b9eb3f435843/)

<br>
<h4 style="display: inline-block;"><img src="img/soil_icon.png" alt="description of the image" style="vertical-align: middle; margin: 0px 10px; width: 5%">Soil</h4>

```{r out.width='30%', out.extra='style="float:right; padding:10px"'}
knitr::include_graphics("img/maps/soil_map.png")
```

The layer was adapted from the Agricultural Areas of Importance originally created by the Conservation Biology Institute for the Santa Barbara County Conservation Blueprint. The map highlights areas of interest for farming and ranching by overlaying a variety of metrics, including information on precipitation, grazing lands, soil characteristics, farmland and feasible agricultural and ranch lands.

You can access the original data here:
[Agricultural "Areas of Importance"](https://sbcblueprint.databasin.org/datasets/807abc2dc06a49b88e815751ffa8a75a/)
